title: Russia’s Wagner Mercenaries Say They'll Pull Out of Bakhmut
description: After seizing the city in eastern Ukraine after a long, brutal fight, the Wagner mercenary force is turning it over to the depleted Russian Army to defend.

title: Here’s Why So Many People Moving to the U.K.
description: Despite post-Brexit restrictions and government vows to control it, immigration to Britain reached an all-time high in 2022, driven by war, politics and economics.

title: The Search for Madeleine McCann in Portugal Is Over, Police Say
description: A search of a reservoir in Portugal that came more than 16 years after the British girl went missing resulted in the collection of some material but did not solve the mystery of her disappearance.

title: Arctic Squirrels Have a Climate Change Problem
description: Climate change appears to be disrupting the hibernation of females in the Far North, scientists say, and that could affect mating season.

title: Rwandan Genocide Fugitive Is Arrested After Being on the Run for 30 Years
description: Accused of having a direct hand in the killing of hundreds of Tutsis, Fulgence Kayishema was arrested in South Africa, where he hid as an asylum seeker.

title: Man Arrested in Downing Street Car Crash in London
description: A man was arrested on “suspicion of criminal damage and dangerous driving,” though there were no initial reports of injuries.

title: Inside Tina Turner’s Quiet Life in Switzerland
description: The woman from Nutbush, Tenn., renounced her American citizenship in 2013 to live a quiet life in Küsnacht on Lake Zurich.

title: Three Killed After Suspected Shooting and Stabbing in Japan
description: The assault on Thursday in the city of Nakano in central Japan took the lives of a woman and two police officers. The police have warned residents to stay indoors until the attacker is apprehended.

title: Australia Remembers Tina Turner With the Nutbush
description: The Nutbush, set to its eponymous song and sometimes considered an unofficial national dance, is popular with all ages and has taken on special significance after the singer’s death.

title: How Erdogan Reoriented Turkish Culture to Maintain His Power
description: Turkey’s president has made a spectacle of the Ottoman past, using monuments and TV shows to rally his voters. His cultural opponents have faced censorship, or jail.

title: Russian Mercenary Leader Says His Forces Are Starting to Leave Bakhmut
description: Days after claiming victory in the war’s deadliest battle, the founder of Russia’s Wagner group said his fighters would transfer their positions in the ruined city to regular Russian forces.

title: Ron DeSantis and the ‘Scaffle’ Vote
description: As DeSantis announces his campaign, we dig into what may be the single most important fact about U.S. politics.

title: Bou Samnang Lost Southeast Asian Games Race, but Won Praise
description: Video of the Cambodian runner Bou Samnang’s rain-soaked performance in a 5,000-meter race resonated with fans who applauded her gritty determination.

title: UK Net Migration Record Poses Sharp Dilemma for Sunak
description: Net migration to Britain has exceeded 600,000 a year, new figures show, stirring tensions in a government that has promised both to stem arrivals and to revive a sluggish economy.

title: What to Know About Russia’s Capture of Bakhmut in Ukraine
description: Moscow has declared victory in its long, bloody assault. But a full capture of the ruined city may not help Russian forces advance deeper in the Donbas region.

title: How Geena Davis Continues to Tackle Gender Bias in Hollywood
description: When it comes to quantifying bias in popular entertainment, the Academy Award winner’s in a league of her own.

title: Russia is Modifying Soviet-Era Bombs to Use Against Ukraine
description: Ukrainian and American officials say Russian warplanes are dropping Soviet-era bombs, some modified to glide long distances, which are almost impossible to shoot down.

title: Airports With the Worst Records for Cancellations and Delays
description: If you can, avoiding destinations with the worst records for delays and cancellations may be wise. Or at least time your arrival right.

title: Your Thursday Briefing
description: Celebrating the life of Tina Turner.

title: Fresh From Attack on Russian Soil, Raiders Taunt the Kremlin
description: The cross-border raid by Russian fighters based in Ukraine appeared intended in part to force Moscow to divert its soldiers from the battlefield.
